title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.B HUMANITARIAN Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) RESPONSE

description.narrative: Output 2.2 : Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and crises affected vulnerable populations are provided access to gender responsive and life-saving emergency WASH services, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescent girls and boys, mothers and fathers, and community leaders in 106 districts adopt 11 key life-saving, care and protective behaviours for children and women

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2 : IDPs and crises affected vulnerable populations are provided access to gender responsive and life-saving emergencyWASH services

description.narrative: Despite continued conflict and sporadic clashes, COVID-19, low emergency funding and major economic challenges, UNICEF made progress in advancing the rights to basic water and basic sanitation. WASH programme provided comprehensive gender sensitive life-saving interventions to IDP’s , disease outbreaks and communities in the protracted crises of Yemen.;.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
